item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Suppose, gentleman, that man is not stupid." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "In the first case, he personally enjoyed the esthetic; in the second case, he esthetically enjoyed his personality." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by P.F. Kluge
item.description: "Solemnity has its limits, it invites derision. But irony is corrosive, it never ends. " -- P.F. Kluge

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "I had fallen in love. What I mean is: I had begun to recognize, to isolate the signs of one of those from the others, in fact I waited for these signs I had begun to recognize, I sought them, responded to those signs I awaited with other signs I made myself, or rather it was I who aroused them, these signs from her, which I answered with other signs of my own . . . " -- Italo Calvino

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Mary Wollstonecraft
item.description: "But what a weak barrier is truth when it stands in the way of an hypothesis!" -- Mary Wollstonecraft

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "What a terrible thing it is to try to let off a little bit of truth into this miserable humbug of a world!" -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Jonathan Lethem
item.description: "I want what we all want," said Carl. "To move certain parts of the interior of myself into the exterior world, to see if they can be embraced." -- Jonathan Lethem

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Jonathan Lethem
item.description: "May one plead, Your Honor, postmodernism as an involuntary condition?" -- Jonathan Lethem

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by John Darnielle
item.description: "The most remarkable thing about you standing in the doorway is that it’s you, and that you’re standing in the doorway." -- John Darnielle

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by T.H. White
item.description: "You run a grave risk, my boy," said the magician, "of being turned into a piece of bread, and toasted." -- T.H. White

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by T. H. White
item.description: "The most difficult thing in the world is to know how to do a thing and to watch someone else do it wrong without comment." -- T. H. White

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by John Darnielle
item.description: "When you punish a person for dreaming his dream Don't expect him to thank or forgive you." -- John Darnielle

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Zadie Smith
item.description: "Each couple is its own vaudeville act." -- Zadie Smith

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Zadie Smith
item.description: "The greatest lie ever told about love is that it sets you free." -- Zadie Smith

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Zadie Smith
item.description: "Any woman who counts on her face is a fool." -- Zadie Smith

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Franz Wright
item.description: "We are created by being destroyed." -- Franz Wright

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Franz Wright
item.description: "literature will lose, sunlight will win, don't worry." -- Franz Wright

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by A.S. Byatt
item.description: "He felt changed, but there was no one to tell." -- A.S. Byatt

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by John Darnielle
item.description: "People say friends don't destroy one another - what do they know about friends?" -- John Darnielle

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by John Darnielle
item.description: "when you punish a person for dreaming his dream, don't expect him to thank or forgive you (the mountain goats - the best ever death metal band in denton)" -- John Darnielle

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Franz Wright
item.description: "But if they were condmened to suffer this unending torment, sooner or later wouldn't they become the holy?" -- Franz Wright

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by George MacDonald
item.description: "We are all very anxious to be understood, and it is very hard not to be. But there is one thing much more necessary.' What is that, grandmother?' To understand other people.' Yes, grandmother. I must be fair - for if I'm not fair to other people, I'm not worth being understood myself. I see." -- George MacDonald

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by George MacDonald
item.description: "Our life is no dream; but it ought to become one, and perhaps will." -- George MacDonald

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by George MacDonald
item.description: "I don't know how to thank you.' Then I will tell you. There is only one way I care for. Do better, and grow better, and be better." -- George MacDonald

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Goodbye," said the fox. "And now here is my secret, a very simple secret: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "All grown-ups were once children... but only few of them remember it." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
letterbyletter add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "What makes the desert beautiful,' said the little prince, 'is that somewhere it hides a well..." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "The simple things are also the most extraordinary things, and only the wise can see them." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: letterbyletter add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Remember that wherever your heart is, there you will find your treasure." -- Paulo Coelho
